comments.author: CryptoHeadlineNews
comments.body: But why do you need a special thread or board for testing when you already have the "Preview" button down below which also does the same work for testing and enables you to see how the post may likely look like if eventually posted live onto the forum. Because those videos given by "Little Mouse" will teach you how to navigate the forum, but if you want to test, I think the "Preview" feature should be enough to do that if you don't mind. Thank you

comments.body: You have few thread links which can guide you well in posting related things on forum and to add on I also created one such thread long ago to help newbies who face problems.You can check it out and see how you can utilise different functions to create good topics :  Posting techniques for newbies .So hope it helps you in some ways.

comments.author: Pmalek
comments.body: Quote from: PytagoraZ on June 07, 2023, 03:13:02 PM1. Test creating a post You just did. Not only this post, but a total of 12 posts on Bitcointalk.Quote from: PytagoraZ on June 07, 2023, 03:13:02 PM2. Test make a post with special characters like (quote, color, insert code, font, etc) It doesn't require any special knowledge. Just highlight a character, word, sentence, or complete post and click the button you want (quote, code, bold, etc.). Changing fonts and colors is not something you really need to do. Posting in multiple colors shouldn't be done in a normal forum conversation. The process is the same for everything else you used. The 'Preview' button shows you exactly how your post will look like once you hit the 'Post' button. It's also a good way to doublecheck your spelling, typos, etc. before posting.

comments.author: Faisal2202
comments.body: Quote from: PytagoraZ on June 07, 2023, 03:13:02 PMOr Archival is a theard dedicated to test posting?Dear Op, i did not know that was happening in Archival Board, because i think i never opened it, just opened it and read many topics created by the title of Test, etc. So far from what i have observed, i think you are right about one thing. But i have no knowledge of that board as i said never opened it before so before posting there for testing DYOR. But i encourage you to take part in your local community because there no one will make fun of your posts, in fact, they might help you to understand things. Like when i was new to this posting mechanism (especially to quoting and multi-quoting then i stuck a lot) and my local member helped me a lot and i can see on a monthly basis when a newbie comes to this platform and make a mistake in multi-quoting (in our local thread), many members try to help him/her, so in that way, you will be contributing to your community too and getting someplace in your community while learning too about how to make all the aforementioned posts.
